channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: The Women of 9/11: Disney+ documentary looks at how some picked up their lives
item.description: This should be next on your list if you've been watching any of the 20th anniversary coverage of the September 11 attacks.
item.dc:creator: KATE ROBERTSON

item.title: Covid-19: Foodstuffs confirms likely infectious delivery driver visited stores in Hamilton, Cambridge and Tauranga
item.description: Yet the supermarkets have not been deemed locations of interest as delivery areas are not accessible to the public.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT YEOMAN AND LUKE KIRKEBY

item.title: Victims of Timaru homicide are three children under the age of 10
item.description: Neighbours overheard man saying 'is this really happening?' before police find three bodies at property, which is understood to be used for hospital staff.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN GUILDFORD RACHAEL COMER YASHAS SRINIVASA

item.title: Low-user electricity tariffs will be phased out over 5 years
item.description: Change likely to mean 59% of households pay about $600 a year more in fixed charges, but Government believes it will balance out.
item.dc:creator: TOM PULLAR-STRECKER

item.title: Joseph Parker out to prove his point in rematch with Dereck Chisora
item.description: December sequel in Manchester confirmed with Parker confident he can clearly dominate this time.
item.dc:creator: DUNCAN JOHNSTONE

item.title: Man in ICU after Friday morning house fire in Waitara
item.description: A man in his 40s is in ICU in hospital after an early morning fire in Waitara.
item.dc:creator: JANE MATTHEWS

item.title: Covid-19: Cook Islands approves vaccine for ages 12-15 for October roll-out
item.description: Cook Islands PM says he wants everyone eligible to get their jab: "It may save your child’s life."
item.dc:creator: TORIKA TOKALAU

item.title: All Blacks: Ian Foster explains 'great balancing act' ahead of Pumas test
item.description: Ian Foster had no choice but to take calculated risks ahead of the test against the Pumas.
item.dc:creator: RICHARD KNOWLER

item.title: Life imprisonment for man who murdered father, half-brother
item.description: In court, it was heard that Nathan Frost harboured a long-standing resentment of his father for leaving his mother and starting a new family.
item.dc:creator: TARA SHASKEY

item.title: Scale of harmful sexual behaviour at Gloriavale revealed as man escapes conviction
item.description: Ex-member escapes conviction for indecent assault against three boys, but court documents reveal up to 60 young people have been involved in harmful sexual behaviour.
item.dc:creator: JOANNE NAISH AND AMBER ALLOTT

item.title: Burger Afloat: New Zealand's first floating burger bar to open in the mountains on Lake Dunstan Trail
item.description: One of the country's most spectacular burger joints is about to open.
item.dc:creator: BROOK SABIN

item.title: Blood Brothers: Netflix explores the friendship that put white America on edge
item.description: How Ali and Malcolm X became mates and the still disputed nature of their falling out is a fantastic prism through which to view American history.
item.dc:creator: GRAEME TUCKETT

item.title: Covid-19: Education Minister Chris Hipkins says school holidays won't be moved in Auckland
item.description: Auckland students will go on holiday at the same time as the rest of New Zealand, despite spending weeks in lockdown.
item.dc:creator: BRIDIE WITTON

item.title: Not every Muslim is extremist: The difference between Islam and Islamism
item.description: OPINION: Every immigrant who comes to New Zealand is categorised. After incidents like the Auckland stabbing or March 15, people start pointing fingers.
item.dc:creator: DR MUHAMMAD UMAR

item.title: Steven Adams ready to bounce back on the grind with the Memphis Grizzlies
item.description: Kiwi star seen as a crucial ingredient for a Grizzlies team firmly on the way up in the NBA.
item.dc:creator: MARC HINTON

item.title: Resident urges speed bumps on Palmerston North street
item.description: It’s a quiet street and Tina Waelen wants to keep it that way. She is lobbying the council to put speed bumps on her street to combat speeding drivers.
item.dc:creator: GEORGE HEAGNEY

item.title: Cops cut short Auckland trio's ski-field trip after alleged Covid lockdown breach
item.description: The trio were nabbed in Ohakune after the documents they used to get ski passes aroused suspicion among ski field staff.
item.dc:creator: AUCKLAND REPORTER

item.title: America's Cup hosting venue decision delayed
item.description: Defenders want more time to explore finer details with all three international options and Auckland still on the table.
item.dc:creator: DUNCAN JOHNSTONE

item.title: Unregistered 'lender' Qualifund to be shut down after tip-off to authorities
item.description: Qualifund claimed to be a lender, but authorities are moving to close the company.
item.dc:creator: ROB STOCK

item.title: Manurewa homicide: Man charged with murder of 16-year-old girl who was found dead in Auckland
item.description: Police said the girl, who has not been named, was “extremely loved” by her family and friends, and they were devastated by her death.
item.dc:creator: MELANIE EARLEY
